Sentencas: Perovskite Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-delta (BSCF) is a promising mixed-conducting ceramic membrane material in addition to being a good electrode catalyst for solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: From chelating precursor to perovskite oxides and hollow fiber membranes

Sentencas: In this study, BSCF powder was synthesized via a chelated water-soluble complex method at relatively low temperatures.
Titulo: From chelating precursor to perovskite oxides and hollow fiber membranes

Sentencas: The combined ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid and citric acid was used for the synthesis of a complex-based precursor, followed by thermal decomposition of the precursor at high temperatures.
Titulo: From chelating precursor to perovskite oxides and hollow fiber membranes

Sentencas: Thermal behavior, crystal phases, and structures of the prepared powders were characterized by thermogravimetric analysis/differential scanning calorimetry, XRD, and scanning electron microscopic (SEM) techniques, respectively.
Titulo: From chelating precursor to perovskite oxides and hollow fiber membranes

Sentencas: Pure and single-phase perovskite could be obtained after sintering at a temperature higher than 800 degrees C for 5 h. The soft precursor powder synthesized at lower temperatures, i.e., 600 degrees C, is water insoluble and more appropriate for use as a membrane material to prepare gas-tight tubular or hollow fiber ceramic membranes.
Titulo: From chelating precursor to perovskite oxides and hollow fiber membranes

Sentencas: By contrast, the hollow fibers prepared via the traditional techniques where the perovskite powder is used as the starting membrane materials display gas leakage.
Titulo: From chelating precursor to perovskite oxides and hollow fiber membranes

Sentencas: The fibers were characterized by SEM, XRD, and tested for air separation at ambient pressure and temperatures between 700 degrees and 950 degrees C.
Titulo: From chelating precursor to perovskite oxides and hollow fiber membranes

Sentencas: The oxygen flux measured in this work reached 3.90 mL.(min.cm(2))(-1) and compares favorably with any experimental values reported in the open literature.
Titulo: From chelating precursor to perovskite oxides and hollow fiber membranes
